ShouldersLVBehindNeckPressH.name: Lever Behind Neck Press (plate loaded)
ShouldersLVBehindNeckPressH.preparation: Sit back on seat. Grasp lever bars to each side with overhand grip.
ShouldersLVBehindNeckPressH.execution: Press levers upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersLVBehindNeckPressH.comments: Exercise can also be performed on certain lever shoulder presses by facing away from machine. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.
ShouldersLVBehindNeckPressH.synergists: supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, tricepsbrachii, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior

ShouldersLVBBBehindNeckPress.name: Lever Barbell Behind Neck Press (plate loaded)
ShouldersLVBBBehindNeckPress.preparation: Sit on bench with bar positioned behind shoulders, also facing away from fulcrum. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
ShouldersLVBBBehindNeckPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower bar behind neck and repeat.
ShouldersLVBBBehindNeckPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.
ShouldersLVBBBehindNeckPress.synergists: supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, tricepsbrachii, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior

ShouldersLVMilitaryPressH.name: Lever Military Press (plate loaded)
ShouldersLVMilitaryPressH.preparation: Set and grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
ShouldersLVMilitaryPressH.execution: Press lever until arms are extended upward. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersLVMilitaryPressH.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. Movement angle is arguably similar to lever incline press, for upper chest. Seat should be set so only slight stretch is felt in shoulder at bottom of movement.
ShouldersLVMilitaryPressH.synergists: trapeziusmiddle, pectoralisclavicular, tricepsbrachii, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior

ShouldersLVReclinedShoulderPressPL.name: Lever Reclined Shoulder Press (plate loaded)
ShouldersLVReclinedShoulderPressPL.preparation: Lie on back pad facing up. Grasp lever handles on each side with overhand grip.
ShouldersLVReclinedShoulderPressPL.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersLVReclinedShoulderPressPL.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.
ShouldersLVReclinedShoulderPressPL.synergists: supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, deltoidlateral, tricepsbrachii, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior

ShouldersLVShoulderPressH.name: Lever Shoulder Press (plate loaded)
ShouldersLVShoulderPressH.preparation: Set and grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
ShouldersLVShoulderPressH.execution: Press lever upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
ShouldersLVShoulderPressH.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.
ShouldersLVShoulderPressH.synergists: trapeziusmiddle, pectoralisclavicular, tricepsbrachii, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior

ShouldersLVBBShoulderPress.name: Lever Barbell Shoulder Press (plate loaded)
ShouldersLVBBShoulderPress.preparation: Sit on bench with bar positioned in front of shoulders. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
ShouldersLVBBShoulderPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower bar to front of shoulders and repeat.
ShouldersLVBBShoulderPress.comments: Pull head back slightly so bar does not head. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.
ShouldersLVBBShoulderPress.synergists: trapeziusmiddle, pectoralisclavicular, tricepsbrachii, deltoidlateral, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior

ShouldersLVOneArmShoulderPress.name: Lever One Arm Shoulder Press (plate loaded)
ShouldersLVOneArmShoulderPress.preparation: Stand to one side, near loaded end of barbell, opposite of landmine lever. Lift end of barbell and position near shoulder with underhand grip. Stand with feet far apart (leg on same side of loaded arm is back and opposite leg is forward and bent).
ShouldersLVOneArmShoulderPress.execution: Press end of barbell upward and forward until arm is extended. Lower to shoulder and repeat. Repeat with opposite side.
ShouldersLVOneArmShoulderPress.comments: Keep back straight when lifting end of barbell from floor. Also see Lever One Arm Press for power.
ShouldersLVOneArmShoulderPress.synergists: supraspinatus, trapeziusmiddle, pectoralisclavicular, tricepsbrachii, trapeziuslower, serratusanterior
